result.execSummary:
The defendant Donterris Montrell Robinson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Obtain an HSED.
Maintain employment of at least 30 hours a week.

No possession of firearms.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may never possess a firearm.

Commit no new law violations.
No violent contact with the victim.

Absolute sobriety from illegal drugs and alcohol. 
Submit to random urine screens.
Defendant to give a copy of any prescription medications to the agent prior to getting those prescriptions filled.
Provide a DNA sample.
Complete an anger management or batters program, whichever program is deemed appropriate.
Court ordered a probation review hearing date be set. 
Court ordered that by the date of the probation review hearing, the defendant be enrolled in, and be making progress toward completing an anger management or batterers program.
Court advised defendant that he/she may not vote until his/her civil rights have been restored.

Stayed to be used at the discretion of the agent.

Court orders stay LIFTED on condition time: Defendant to serve 45 days in the House of Correction.

lifting stay on 45 days condition time.

Defendant Donterris Montrell Robinson not in court, defendant in custody.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State informs Court that defendant has pending charges.

Court orders stay LIFTED on condition time:
Defendant to serve 45 days in the House of Correction.

Clerk:  jms

Defendant Donterris Montrell Robinson not in court, defendant in custody.   Case is scheduled for hearing on return on warrant on 1/3/17 at 8:30 .  Attorney Buckett and ADA Karshen notified.  m
Warrant/Bench Warrant served.

ADA Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Probation Agent Amy McBride-Schmidt appeared in court.
Case set at the Court's order. Statements made regarding the defendant's status on probation by the agent. At the State's request, Court issued a bench warrant with a remand to the court.
Clerk contact ADA Karshen and Probation Agent Amy McBride-Schmidt to set a hearing to address the defendant's status on probation. Case adjourned to 8/4/16 at 10:30 a.m. for Hearing in Branch 25.
Revocation Summary received and filed.

Assistant District Attorney Erin Karshen appeared via telephone. Defendant Donterris Robinson not in court, in custody.
Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Case set for probation review hearing. Clerk notified by the coverage agent via telephone the defendant is in custody at MSDF and has a revocation proceeding scheduled for 6/22/16. Agent will submit a revocation summary to the court. Court took no action and set no future dates at this time.

Defendant Donterris Montrell Robinson in court.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for probation review hearing. Probation Status Review with proposed order for commitment for condition time received and filed. Discussion regarding the defendant's progress on probation. Defendant has not completed the anger management course and has not paid any amount towards the financial obligations. Court ordered the defendant to pay at least $200.00 towards financial obligations and complete the anger management course by 3/21/16. If the defendant does not comply with this order, the Court authorized the agent to use at least 10 days of condition time with Huber release for work. Defendant may serve the Huber time on consecutive weekends. Court ordered another probation review date be set. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for May 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Bail Refund Check Packet
Court retained this matter post-rotation. Case transferred back to Branch 25. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Bail Refund Check Packet

Defendant Donterris Montrell Robinson in court.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm on behalf of Erin Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for probation review hearing. Per Court, attorney Buckett did not need to appear for this hearing. Probation Agent Amy McBride Schmidt also present in court. Probation Status Review report received and filed. Defendant is in compliance with the conditions of probation. Court ordered an additional probation review date be set. Court will retain this matter post-rotation. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for February 19, 2016 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Donterris Montrell Robinson
Current: 2378 N 1st Street, Milwaukee, WI 53212 United States  (Effective: 06-08-2015)
Prior: 9177A N 75th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53223

Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

As to Count 1 amended:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  42 MONTHS with 27 days credit; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 18 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 24 MONTHS.

Court imposed and stayed the sentence and placed the defendant on 3 years probation. 

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program or the WI Substance Abuse program.

Conditions of probation:
- Court imposed and stayed 45 days condition time to be used at the discretion of the agent.
- Obtain an HSED
- Maintain employment of at least 30 hours a week
- Commit no new law violations.
- Absolute sobriety from illegal drugs and alcohol. 
- Submit to random urine screens.
- Defendant to give a copy of any prescription medications to the agent prior to getting those prescriptions filled.
- No possession of firearms.
- No violent contact with the victim.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Complete an anger management or batters program, whichever program is deemed appropriate.


Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $0.00; 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA surcharge); 
-  Cash bail on deposit to be applied.
-  If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he/she may not vote until his/her civil rights have been restored.  

Court ordered a probation review hearing date be set. 
Court ordered that by the date of the probation review hearing, the defendant be enrolled in, and be making progress toward completing an anger management or batterers program.

Court ordered the final pretrial scheduled for 06/15/2015 and the jury trial scheduled for 07/15/2015  vacated.

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Probation Review Hearing scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant sworn in.
As to Count 1 as amended: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Defendant Donterris Montrell Robinson in court with attorney Robert W. Buckett.  Defendant Donterris Montrell Robinson in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Substantial Battery, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section 940.19(2), a Class I Felony.
